Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: staryn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the setiere of Dorsoduro, a really nice part of Venice - Very central and only 2 minutes away from the Accademia vaporetto ride. The area is quiet. The hotel was very clean, staff welcoming. The breakfast was typical and same daily. The bed linen was not changed during our stay but towels were. It was perfectly clean and I would recommend it, although we paid quite a bit, some Eur 480 for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NYCJulieB
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Belle Arti is in a wonderful location in Venice - literally about 100 yards from the Accademia bridge and vaporetto stop. By foot, Piazza San Marco is about 10 minutes away. My room (303) was decorated in the over-the-top style you see on the website, and the room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. The window had no view to speak of; there was another building just a few feet away. However, I didn't visit Venice to stay in my room! A few friends of mine had rooms in the annex, which were much less nice than mine (plainly decorated, much smaller, no bidet), so I would suggest that you make a request not to be in the annex. Breakfast was fine; an attendant made fresh cappuccino on request, which was great, and there were some cereals, meats, breads, and canned fruits and juices. The internet requires a fee, and it would not work in my room but was fine in the lobby area. If you can get a good price for this hotel, it is in a great location and since you are in Venice to see the city, that is very important.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are variable”
Reviews.Author: poesy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for me by a group I traveled with. I had a single room. Rooms are variable. From what I saw of the double rooms, most were nice, had small sofas and luggage racks. My room had no luggage rack and nowhere to put or open luggage. Not much room to move around, no other seating but the bed. The bed was two thin twin mattresses side by side on a plank. Not very comfortable. And there was no mattress pad. They said it was a double room, and know that others in my group who were sharing had similar accommodations for two. The entrance to the hotel is nice -- into a garden/patio. But they play music there ALL the time. I had a room over the entrance and had to move. I could not rest because of the music that invaded my room, even with the windows shut and curtains drawn. The room I was then given was on the back and very quiet. But it was also very cold. I had trouble sleeping because of the cold. I asked many times, but the staff said the heat was on in my room. It didn't seem to make any difference. The staff in general were not very helpful or friendly. Though there is a bar in the lobby, getting someone to make you a coffee in the afternoon was difficult. The breakfast is ordinary continental -- cereal, yoghurt, bread, cheese, sliced meat. The hotel is easy to access because it is halfway between the Academia and Zattere stops for vaporetto or water taxi. And you can easily roll luggage there without having to navigate steps or bridges. So the location is good, but the hotel leaves something to be desired. I would insist on a real double room with a luggage rack on the back side of the hotel if I ever went there again. But don't expect generosity of service. I'd choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: artprof13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Dorsoduro, minutes away from the Accademia Gallery (and bridge) - a great location if you want to be away from the crowds but still easily accessible to Venice's main sites. The hotel itself was average - a fairly standard 3-star type European hotel with small rooms, relatively uncomfortable beds, and no amenities to speak of. But, you get what you pay for. Two particularly annoying elements - the shower in my room was alternately freezing or scalding which was not terribly pleasant and the internet service is slow and only available in the lobby. The hotel does have a lovely outside courtyard and garden.

Reviews.Title: “realy nice”
Reviews.Author: ana m
Reviews.Content: we traveled there with all the family and a baby.The location is perfect, anyway Venice is a jewel. The hotel isn't so perfect but it doesen't preted to be . We were so scared that we'll end up in this location in front of the hotel as some people reported but I guess we were lucky and we didn't. All our group rented 3 rooms and all of them were really nice and cozy. As for the bathroom, just a shower, but it isn't so bad . In so many other places we had the same and it was ok. The breakfast is impresive and coffee excelent . I really don,t know why other people were disapointed. Our room was a bit cold (well..january) but the guy from the reception desk helped us with it. so overall, a nice place, just try to find a good price. I wouldn't advice paying 200 euros for the night as I read some people did: yes, you'll have different expectations and then you'll be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stuff is a gang of crooks. They steals a money from CC!!!”
Reviews.Author: SergiiPo
Reviews.Content: Stuff is a gang of crooks. ATTENTION it is not just my opinion it is real situation. I have approve from bank that they have stolen my money from credit card and won't return it back. They don't reject this but wan't return trying to make me foolish with stupid explanation. I have created request to the bank and to the police. Hope that personal will be catched and fired. Be attentive with Veronica and Roberta managers, they are responsible for that. Don't use CC in this hotel and be careful with money, or better use another hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Belle Arti with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Naomisan_HU
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 4 days / 3 nights at this 3* Hotel Belle Arti between Christmas and New Year time. The location of Hotel Belle Arti is simply excellent. We had no difficulty to find it. The best way to get there is with vaporetto (eg. #1), which stops at Academia. (You can check the vaporettos' timetables at http://www.actv.it/en/movinginvenice/waterbusservicestimetable ) You only have to get off, turn left and almost immediately right and after an appr. 1 min. walk on a flat street, you arrive to the check-in desk of Hotel Belle Arti. (We've seen sooo many people struggling with their huge luggages on wheels throught the steps and bridges in the inner city.) The location is good also for visiting the city. Saint Marc's Square and all main tourist attractions are close (in appr. 5-10 min. walk distance). The reception of Hotel Belle Arti, (at which you have to do your check-in also for the Domus Cavanis), pretends to be super busy. The staff do not provide tourist information in extended level, they only do their minimum. Until you do not start asking questions, they are nice. If you want to keep this kind attitude of theirs, I advise you not force receiving answer to your touristic questions... :) If you need plus info about dining or POIs, you will have to buy a book or look for a tourist info center. The room was very clean and simply beautiful. There was TV, which did not work but it was not the main point for us anyway... We found the breakfast to be very good. It is true that the type of food was the same every morning (ham, cheese, bread, cakes, yoghurt, muesli, coffee, tea, juices, etc.) but the sortiment and the volume was more than enough and their quality was perfect. Please note when you book a hotel, the price does not include the local tourist tax, which has to be paid upon arrival. So in general I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: noddy1
Reviews.Content: Its difficult to find any faults to this hotel. It is easily accessible from airport, very close to San Marco square, Rialto bridge and the center of Venice. Rooms are stylish, very clean. Room maid visits rooms every day changing towels, glases (plastic though) and adding shampoos and soaps. Breakfast is very decent with good coffee. Staff has acceptable knowledge of English and is very helpful. Very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers but where is Basil?”
Reviews.Author: Vkayc
Reviews.Content: Door fell off cupboard . Covers missing on power points, shower. One power point usable. Long queue for breakfast with food running out. No tea making facilities in room. Antique TV sometimes in colour. Barrel came out when removing key from safe. No porter to help with luggage to water taxi, even offered â‚¬20. Hardly any English spoken. At least Basil had Manuel to make us laugh. Good points include nice gardens, outside seating area, restaurant next door excellent. Close to museums. No idea how they manage to rate three stars. Ps I travel extensively.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: Florincourtman
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week with a small group of painters. They all had nice rooms and mine was perfectly adequate: quiet, comfortable with a good shower. Breakfast was good although proper orange juice would have been an improvement. We were there during a really hot week and really appreciated the outdoor terrace for breakfast and drinks in the evening. An peaceful outdoor space is quite a luxury in Venice and we were glad to have that facility. The location was perfect, equidistant between the Zattere and Accademia vaporetto stops and there were nice canals and restaurants nearby. All in all a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs + Rude staff = Worst stay”
Reviews.Author: DLS90
Reviews.Content: On the first night of our two-night stay, I woke up with bites on my back. Only a couple, so I assumed I must have been bitten during my stay in Venice. Boy was I wrong. I woke up the next day with over forty bites covering my entire body... AND 400 ants in our beds, bags, clothes. It was horrible! Not only was I uncomfortable, I felt disgusting. When we told the staff at the desk what happened, they accused us of trying to get out of paying for the room EVEN THOUGH they saw that we all had bites and I was covered. To make it worse, one of them came to our room and saw the ants and still said it was OUR fault for having food. I assure you, we did not have anything in the room besides water. We were yelled at and they were extremely rude. Eventually we had to leave. While outside, we met two other groups who felt the exact same way and one woman was covered in bites like I was. I would NEVER stay here again and advise others to find a different place.

Reviews.Title: “An acquired taste”
Reviews.Author: matjabsa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three weeks. Initially, I was in a single room, which was very small with a single bed - very European and different from standards in Australia and, I suspect, the US where single rooms usually have a double bed. Every surface is covered in either red or green-blue heavy brocade fabric and furniture is (faux) antique. Fittings were fine but the hotel could do with an update. Breakfast was by far the best aspect - if you want 'real' coffee you need to ask one of the signore who can be quite gruff but are actually very accommodating. WiFi is hard to access upstairs so if you need it you might need to ask for a room immediately above reception. The rooms can be dark. I was moved to a larger room after the first week which gave a little more space. There are rooms of differing sizes - my brother also stayed and his room was very spacious. The hotel was very busy on the weekends but very quiet during the week as there is a lot of weekend European tourism to Venice. I would definitely stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Worst hotel, Worst staff, Stay away”
Reviews.Author: 60763Tourist
Reviews.Content: We were not supposed to stay at this hotel, but the hotel that we booked(Hotel Ateneo) sent us here because they overbooked or most probably it was planned - we paid for better more expensive hotel in the center of the city, and they sent us to this crap hole. First of all the front desk staff as well as manager and the owner at the hotel are extremely rude, absolutely not helpful ignorant jerks. After staying first night there we went out , and while we were away they took all of our staff from the room without our permission, threw everything in the bags and move it to another hotel. When we came back they already gave our room to someone else and did not have any other room available. My wife's shoes went missing, and most of our cloths were ruined by the creams and cosmetics that they just threw in the bags together with everything else. The manager felt like there was absolutely nothing wrong with that and did not apologize once for what they've done. For our second night they put us to a different hotel across the street Domus Cavanis which is owned by the same people and which is a one star hotel. Next day i spoke to the owner which again was like talking to the wall, no remorse whatsoever, looks like that is normal practice for them. i file a claim for missing and damaged items, and of course i never heard from him again. This hotel as well as Ateneo have ruined my impression of Venice and Italy. As far as Belle Arti hotel itself, it was one of the worst i ever stayed at. They sell it as air conditioned rooms but the air conditioner is blowing worm air and the temperature in the room doesn't go below 28 Celsius (82 Fahrenheit). the room is so small that you cannot open the door to the bathroom because the bed is on the way. when you get into the shower you cant even raise your arms it's so small (i'm not big man, average size). Window is overlooking backyard where the trash is stored. The room is old is falling apart, the wallpapers with holes and stains,broken molding, and the furniture that needed to be replaced 20 years ago. The carpet is dirty and everything smells like someone died in that room. Basically it was a horrendous experience and if you don't want you vacation to be ruined by this hotel or Ateneo hotel. Please stay away from either one of them.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel will be back”
Reviews.Author: Northernirishman
Reviews.Content: I as with my mother on a trip to Italy and we had so free time so we headed to Venice for the afternoon /evening just going to see back streets and st marks square etc again but we had never stayed in Venice so for a change we dicided to find a hotel we looked at several hotel when i asked they were fully booked i was almost back were we started and there were 3 hotels and if i didnt get into one of these we would have to drive out of the city i was in the last one and he said he was fully booked again i said i would have to go on trip advisor and tell people to make sure they had a room booked before coming to venice to this he replied do you work in a hotel i said yes he then said his sister hotel had a room he made a phone call and booked it for me and told me were it was and this was a great hotel only 10 mins from st.marks square i was so glad we got to the hotel checkin was so easy and are bags were taken to our room we got changed and went down for a drink and then a walk around late at night felt so safe and had another drink in an out door cafe staff are so freindly and helpful the room not the biggest but was well furnished and clean we had breakfast the next morniing it was good for continental but not as good as the hotels back home but we didnt mind checkout again smooth loved the decor and as my mum said this is a Sally`s` room my mother taste of decor

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: albayady
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel ever, rooms are very small, very bad smell, air conditioner is very hot and humid , the worst people on the reception desk unhelpful and really ignorant, I really don't recommend to any one , it was a terrible experience for me and my wife for 3 nightsâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: EGGs60
Reviews.Content: First time I stayed here was in 1998 and it was really nice. Those days are gone. Snotty staff, minute rooms, generally unhelpful. Good location though. But that's it. Don't use this place. Try the Do' Pozzi instead - friendly small central hotel in similar price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “orange squash pretending to be orange juice”
Reviews.Author: pinkyfeet
Reviews.Content: Only in Venice is such a hotel possible. A hotel of this standard in any other city would be pushing it to charge a quater of what Belle Arti manages to get away with. Do yourself a favour and research the hotels properly in Venice, there are fantastic 4 star places for the same price range. I have no idea how this can be a three star hotel. Service is a joke and rude at times. Breakfast verges on inedible with orange squash pretending to be orange juice, and milk that is watered down. The rest of the food is stale and cheapest possible.

Reviews.Title: “Cutting corners elevated to an art form”
Reviews.Author: SheEats
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel is cheap but its location. Because of its location the owners can afford to cut corners on just about everything else. Let's start with the bedroom: the smallest room I have ever been in a 3 star hotel: not even enough room to open a suitcase properly, not enough room to put two toothbrushes in the bathroom. There was no fridge. There was a 1980s TV set. There was fake brocade collecting dust everywhere. Let's go to the breakfast room: fake coffee, chemical cordial passing as orange juice, teapots that could not pour, and on the table plastic flowers of the kind one finds in cemeteries. Let's go to reception: only one of the concierges speaks English.

Reviews.Title: “not too expensive but clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: christina_k257
Reviews.Content: it was clean, cheap, the stuff was very friendly (they recommended us some restaurants and bars and they were all great) , the breakfast was very good, not too rich but the cakes and the croissants were fresh and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ralw3190
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel my someone who stayed here the weekend before I planned to visit. So I booked it up straight away and was then rather worried to see so many poor reviews. I booked a single room for one night, the bed was big (a queen or king sized one) the room was clean as was the bathroom. The dÃ©cor was a little dark, but drawing the curtains or turning on the light solved that problem. After reading some of the reviews, I was scared that I'd open the door and it'd hit the bed. But no! There was plenty of space. The breakfast was okay (I'm no fan of continental breakfast), the hot chocolate was lovely! The staff were all helpful and polite. For â‚¬50 a night in somewhere like Venice, I really don't think you can expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms but we were lucky!”
Reviews.Author: Gondola
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lovely garden and outside area which we loved. We enjoyed our stay but would not return. The standard rooms are very very small, even for Venice and quite dark. We were given a room on the first floor which was horrible (although it did have a view of the garden which was nice) so went back to reception and just asked if they had a nicer room. We were then given a room on a higher floor but didn't seem any different apart from it had a horrible view!! Back to reception where i just said 'it's worse'. The same lady sighed a bit and gave me another key saying 'this is our best room'. It was on the 4th floor and much bigger, a view of the garden and a huge side terrace with chairs and a table. It was lovely. The reason we wouldn't go back is to pay for that room would be substantially more and there is far better in Venice. I would add that when we checked in we were dealt with by a very unhelpful, rude man however on returning to reception to ask for another room he had gone and the lady who helped us, although not overly friendly, did deal with our request politely. Her name was Claudia. Breakfast was quite good and the hotel was fairly quiet. The hotel is in a good location if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle yet still a short walk from lots of restaurants and bars. Close to Campo Santa Margherita and San Barnaba, both good lively atmosphere and good restaurants. It is very close to Accademia Vaporetti and also only a short walk from Zattere Vaporetti. Just love Venice and keep going back. It doesn't have to be expensive - lunchtime we mostly eat in the bacaris and in the evening if you avoid the tourist type restaurants it's no more expensive that in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: 4thlevel1
Reviews.Content: I will spell it out for you; I am an Airline Pilot that owns a Travel Agency. I have stayed in easily over 5000 hotel rooms in all classes in all parts of the world. This was the worst. The worst in terms of size - even for European standards, and by FAR the worst is service. The room barley accommodated the bed and the staff is truly uncaring. We are gladly forfeiting $350 for our 3rd night to stay somewhere - anywhere - else. We told them after our 1st night we would be checking out a day early. Their response? Fine, but we're keeping your money for all 3 nights. Unbelievable. We're outta here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: 4thLevel
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably cramped room, rude staff, WAY overpriced. Booked 3 nights but leaving after one. Writing this review from our shoebox room. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “The Rudest, Most Inconsiderate Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sobie1
Reviews.Content: In fairness we did not stay at this hotel but we did get to deal with the staff on two occasions. After a problem with the B&B we initially booked the owner of that establishment took it upon himself to book us a hotel at a place called Domus Cavanis. Domus Cavanis is run by the same people who run Belle Arti and is directly across the street. You must go to the Belle Arti to check in. While checking in we were ignored for a while. After that we dealt with a woman who was extremely rude and unhelpful. Once we finally got our keys we checked out our room and were horrified. We went back to the Belle Arti and spoke with the same woman. We told her that the room was not what we expected. I asked if we could change rooms, I would even pay for the upgrade if necessary. Her only reply was 'No.' if we wanted a new room we would have to pay for the one we already booked and then pay full price for a new room. Just based on the way we were treated I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. People who work hard for their money and expect a nice vacation shouldn't have to deal with people like the staff at Belle Arti.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: loulouBath
Reviews.Content: Good location near the Accademia water bus stop. Found the staff friendly. Air conditioning was put on in our room when we arrived which was a relief as it was very hot when we were there. Room clean. Bit dark because of the decor {dark red and cream} The shutters were down when we got to the room,but found the switch next to the bed which operated them, Continental breakfast which was adequate cereals,ham,cheese,fruit and the croissants were lovely. You were asked which hot drink you wanted. There were comfortable chairs outside. It would have been nice to have been able to get a drink when sat out there during the day. There is a bar but never saw it open. Ideal location for the water buses, either Accademia or Zaterre. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “All Concerns Dismissed - Cannot Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: RonandK
Reviews.Content: On our last trip to Venice in 2008 we walked past this hotel and made a note for future reference because we liked the appearance and location. We went back to the city last week for 4 nights having booked this hotel in September but were concerned about some of the poor reviews on TA. We need not have worried and had a wonderful stay - our room was excellent and the service from all staff within the hotel was superb. We have visited Venice several times now and have always chosen a different sestiere in which to stay but will next time make an exception and revisit the Belle Arti mainly for its great service and value but also for its ideal location midway between two main vaporetto routes serving both the Grand Canal (Accademia Stop) and the Guidecca (Zattere stop) sides of the city.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: batakoja
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, situated less than 20m from the sea shore, very close walking distance to San Marco Square, but still a step away from the crowd. It is in a quiet artistic neighbourhood (many galleries, the museam of Peggy Gugenheim etc). There is a Billa supermarket very close to the hotel for those that want to pass a on lower budget for the main necessities. The hotel is a good 3 star hotel, we considered it is a good value for the last minute price we booked through booking.com (50Euros for double room with buffet breakfast). The room decor was a bit of too much baroque and too much red color for our taste, but the room was clean, heated and quiet during night, which was the most important. Oh, yes, there was no mini bar in our room so you might wanna check this out if you are going to stay longer. We were staying only for one night so we didnt really mind it. The buffet breakfast was good. You could take your coffee out in the nice garden, enjoy sounds of classical music and smoke. Pleasant place to stay, I'd consider it for next stays in Venice for sure.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, but aside from the amazing location, no glowing compliments, either”
Reviews.Author: brooklynite011
Reviews.Content: Our family of six adults stayed at this completely average hotel for three nights in January. The main reason we chose this hotel was the location: the Dorsoduro is charming, quiet, near the Zattere, and has some of the best museums in the city (Accademia, Peggy Guggenheim, Ca'Rezzonico). Also, it's a fifteen-minute walk from St. Mark's Square, VERY close to water taxi stops, there are lots of great restaurants in the area, and it feels less touristy than other parts of Venice. The Belle Arti is nothing special, but it was well-priced in the off-season. The rooms are tiny and out-of-date, but the bathroom was very clean. The heat worked well, which was important during cold, rainy January. Aside from the croissants, the breakfast was sub-standard. From the outside, the hotel is pretty cute: we wished the weather had been nicer so we could have taken advantage of the lovely outdoor courtyard. We really have no complaints, but aside from the amazing location, we have no words of high praise, either. Overall, it was a good value and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Be Afraid, Be Very Afraid”
Reviews.Author: rettravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at this hotel 3 times in 2000 - 2001. Not a luxury hotel but well located and it was clean and the staff cheerful and helpful. Not the case anymore. Our room was bug infested and filthy. The manager couldn't care less. We were going to stay 2 nights but I cancelled after a sleepless night. The bedspread (and room) was filthy, so we pulled off the bedspread and replaced it with a blanket from the closet. The blanket was worse. It was covered with a greasy substance. This manager who was not interested in the condition of the room but insistent upon charging us for the 2nd night anyway. No doubt this manager is responsible for running what was once a good hotel with great staff into the ground. We had been looking forward to our return visit to Venice but this hotel ruined it for us. We cut our stay short and travelled onto the Tuscany region where we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Killer10
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and good retreat away from the crowds - yet still in central venice. Close to water bus stop. Very clean and comfortable, good air con. Breakfast was simple. Staff could be more helpful. Next time would conside looking at hotels less cental to get more for money as water bus and walking is so pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveller77
Reviews.Content: Beware of this Hotel. There are two seperate hotels across from each other but owned by the same entity, Hotel Belle Arti and Hotel Belle Epoque. I was transferred by another hotel to what I thought was Hotel Belle Arti but they send me accross to their sister Hotel Belle Epoque instead promising the same type of accomodation. The building seems like a hospital. The door to my room looked like a janitors door with a paper taped on it with the room number written in a red marker. When I asked the front staff about the room they claimed it was the "VIP" room. I couldn't help but laugh at that point and asked them to cancel my reservation and that I would much rather find another hotel. Their response was for me to be aware that once I cancelled the room it would not be available to me anymore. This hotel is the worst of the worst. I gladly took my chances trying to find another hotel on a busy weekend in Venice rather then staying there. The alternative would have been to leave Venice. If you like to have a hospital room with staff that lies and is rude for 200 euros a night then you have found the right place.

Reviews.Title: “WORST OF THE WORST”
Reviews.Author: linniep
Reviews.Content: Our arrival in Venice was to pouring rain and flooded streets. Even though the location was convenient, we still pulled our suitcases through 8" of water.The hotel provided a narrow piece of wood for people to use as a ramp over the large puddle at the front step. It was not wide enough for our suitcases! We can't believe that this was the first time this situation has occured in a city surrounded by water! The staff told us there was no laundromat nearby to dry all of our wet clothes, nor did they offer for us to use their dryer. The room was small, and the bathroom ceiling was lined with mildew. When we commented, the staff told us it was because it rained today. That mildew was growing for longer than a day! The room had an old, small tv. When we asked if there were any English speaking channels we were told CNN & BBC. We still haven't found them. The buffet breakfast was terrible. The orange juice was watered down, and the rest of the food was just o.k.. When my husband asked for a fork, he was directed to a piece of furniture in the room with a closed drawer. I think they expected us to guess where they kept things. The hotel turned off the air conditioning even though it was still hot & humid outside, and the towel warmer didn't work so we were unable to use it to dry some wet clothes. After staying at 3 other FABULOUS hotels on this trip, we have concluded that for the price$$$, this place was the absolute worst! When we complained and told the front desk that we had stayed in much nicer places for less money, his response was " But they weren't in Venice!" Beautiful city--TERRIBLE HOTEL By the way, also the only place we stayed that didn't take American Express!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: Bing05
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The air conditioning worked great which we really appreciated after our stay somewhere else. The rooms were clean, not large, but comfortable. The bathroom was a little small along with the shower but it was okay. I recommend you use their hairdryer even if you brought a converter. While getting ready one morning, using our hairdryer, our power went out. We had the blind closed, which was electric, so it was pitch black in our room. You can not call the front desk from your room, or if you can, we couldn't figure it out. We attempted to get dressed in the dark and go down to the front desk for help. They came up and flipped a switch in our room and the power came back on, but it delayed us quite a bit. We enjoyed eating cheese and crackers and having wine in the courtyard in the evening. There were large cushioned chairs to relax in and we really enjoyed this space. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast had plenty of selections. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: travelmom26
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel, a quiet and delightful area close to everything. The outdoor garden area was wonderful but as others have mentioned, the rooms are not special. Our king bed was fine but the kids slept on a very old bunk bed that was not comfortable. It's hard to find quad accomodations. We didn't have any problem with the staff and they explained that they controlled the a/c from their desk, as a way to conserve energy. The room was adequately clean and we spent very little time there except to sleep. We wish the rooms were nicer but the outdoor areas were lovely. I think for the prices we expect more but the standards are different.

Reviews.Title: “Time to get new staff”
Reviews.Author: Winnie999
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the Belle Arti. Firstly, the hotel is in a great location near the Academia Bridge and a 10 minute walk to St Marks Square. The hotel also has a wonderful Courtyard to sit in and the rooms are what you would expect of a 3 star hotel, however they all needed a maintenance person to come in and fix up the door handles and bathrooms. I reported my bathroom door handle had fallen off 3 times and it was never fixed. The staff were awful and you could tell they just did not want to be there and would do nothing to help you in any way. This hotel has huge potential they just need to get new staff and employ a maintenance person!

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, polite but uninterested staff, clean and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: LuccaWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in Dorsoduro, very near Accademia Museum, Bridge and vaporetto stop. You can get there easily by vaporetto (the public water bus) from the Santa Lucia train station, so no need to pay $100 for a private water taxi. The hotel is modern, but rooms are small, and the air conditioning was not on during our stay (May 8 and 9). Luckily, it was stuffy rather than hot, and the mosquitos were not yet out in force, so the simple solution was to open a window. Problem was, we asked for a fan, several times, and no one bothered to find us one--or even to tell us they couldn't find one. That is indicative of the kind of serivice in general. However, if you are undeterred by staff neglect and a price per night of 180 euros and up, this hotel has a charming garden and you can get morning cappuccino and afternoon apertifs at reasonable prices that make lounging in the garden very pleasant indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: gmaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: The room was small. Provided breakfast was OK. Just a typical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TheCards
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights with a Rick Steves tour. Room was small and we did not have too much room for our luggage. Room door were tricky to use. Breakfast was adequate to get us going for the day. Tried to get the room cooled down by speaking to the front desk as advised by tour guide. Desk advised AC not on line at that time of year. Beds were OK as we did not seem to have a problem. The Roll down shutter for the window did not work properly and we could not open or close it, seemed to be jammed halfway. Bathroom was clean and adequate for our needs. Courtyard at hotel was nice as a meeting area and just a place to relax. Hotel was close to water stops and there was an ATM just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: IrishKathy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in mid October, 2008 on a group tour. Weather was in the low 70's so we didn't need to test the air conditioning. You can't beat the location of this hotel--very close to the vaporetto stop, grocery store, and restaurants. Granted, the rooms are small--but who spends time in your room when you are in Venice! Small rooms are expected in Venice--it is just the way it is--unless you want to pay a heavy premium. The room & bathroom were immaculate and the bed was very comfortable, hotel was located in a quiet area for a good night's sleep. The patio & courtyard area were quite lovely--rare to have and a big plus. Found the staff to be very pleasant. The convenience of staying right in Venice was all worth it. You do have to leave the key at the front desk--you wouldn't want to take it with you since it has a very heavy brass weight attached to it. Breakfast was okay--although busy if a tour group came down. Pastries went fast--but they would replenish as soon as you asked (worth the wait--but don't go too far when they come out--they go in a flash). Staff did their best to keep up. Coffee was out of a machine operated by a staff member (seems to be common in other hotels in Italy as well) --it may have been the only way to keep up with the demand. I must admit, it wasn't the cappuccino I remembered Italy to be famous for. Breakfast was adequate. One evening, our group had an impromtu gathering in the courtyard sharing wine & cheese/crackers, etc. This alone was worth the stay--it made for a lovely, relaxing evening. I would definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place”
Reviews.Author: jillhou
Reviews.Content: Nice location - easy to get to from the vaporetto stop. Nice courtyard. Rooms are VERY small and not in very good shape. We had holes in the wall, a backwards shower, missing light bulbs, old, uncomfortable bed. Although they advertise they have A/C - it is not available in October even though the temp in our room was at 80 or so. Makes it very hard to sleep at night - if windows are open, mosquitoes come in the room. Breakfast was mediocre at best. Juice was tasteless - watered down for some reason. Meats and cheeses were what you would buy prepackaged at the grocery store. Staff was ok....although when you asked a question, they looked like you were ignorant. You are supposed to leave the key when you leave, but they don't tell you that..... I would not to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest Front Desk Lady You Will Find In All Of Europe”
Reviews.Author: DowntownMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as part of a group tour. Location is good - just off water taxi stop, and water shuttle to airport. Several shops and restaurants, and a very pricey internet cafe close by. Nice outdoor patio were we spent alot of time, as you don't want to spend time in your "oven" of a room. There was an air-conditioner in our room, that blow warm at three different speeds. Lady at the front desk was the rudest, most unhappy person we've ever encountered. She was there all afternoon and into the evening, the day we checked in, and then she was there again in the morning when we woke up. Does she live behind the check-in desk? Drinks at the hotel bar are severely marked up.

Reviews.Title: “Location isnt everything!”
Reviews.Author: Roydini
Reviews.Content: Be warned. This is best described as a large house with a reception desk in the Lobby. Female staff are especially surly and abrupt. When we checked in we were given no welcome. The keys were thrown across the desk, and then we were left to our own devices. Rooms are tiny ! No drawers, hot water failed constantly, and mysteriously arrived when we complained.. We felt as if we were an inconvenience to them by staying there. Lots of faults, lighting in stairs not working, breakfast scant and unappetising. Shame . Hotel on approach looks great, nice open areas outside, but it fails on warmth, welcome, and facilities. If the owners are reading this, wake up, you should be ashamed... !!

Reviews.Title: “Too little, no value”
Reviews.Author: WhalemanNewHaven_CT
Reviews.Content: My second visit here and the worst of the two. Rooms incredibly small even by Italian standards. Only 1 hanger in the closet. Got some but nothing for hanging pants. Asked 3 times for hangers to hang pants on. Never got any. Sink was cracked and obviously had been for a while. Previous reviewer was right-the coffee was undrinkable. Very close to two churches and the bells start at 7:00 AM and are relentless. The rug at the entry to the hotel had a big hump in it and was a trip hazard-nothing was done to correct it. No ramp to get up the five steps into the entry so luggage had to be carried. Majority of front desk staff in a different time zone. Of the 15 trips to Venice, from 1 star to 4, this was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “The least friendly place in town”
Reviews.Author: tvcares
Reviews.Content: After fantastic experiences in Rome and Florence - where the hotel staff could not do enough for us - we were particularly disappointed with this hotel. To be clear - the males who worked the desk were wonderful - but the females should not be in service positions. The woman who checked us in was cold and just did not want to give us any info. There is a woman who works the desk most of the time with short dark hair - who is the nastiest hotel employee I have ever experienced at any city in the world. She will not look at you - she will ignore your requests - and while you are waiting for her to answer your questions or perform the service you have requested she will type in her computer and forget you are there. It was shocking. Upon first glance the hotel is beautiful - but once you get into your (tiny) room, you will find that there are light bulbs burnt out - the window shade doesn't operate porperly, the shower door is off the track and the "air conditioning" MAYBE will get the temperature down to 85. The one plus is a very nice breakfast that comes with the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: anonAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be better described as Fawlty Towers on steroids. The rooms were tiny and despite asking over 6 months before and being assured that we would receive a room facing onto the courtyard we were given one facing onto the street. However, this was just the beginning. The heated towel rack in the room was broken and when we complained, we were told that was our fault as the window was open! After closing the window and checking this with staff and still no heating in the towel rack, the staff played the "we don't understand English card!" The hair dryer in our room was also broken and was replaced with a hairdryer which continually overloaded the power circuit, consequently turning off the power. The lift was incredibly small and was frequently jammed so the stairs were the only option. This normally this would not be a problem except the stair well lights are turned off after 7pm! (which made it very easy to fall down the stairs) The breakfast was by far and away the worst we experienced in our 21/2 weeks in Italy and the coffee was vomit worthy! The staff were at best unfriendly and unhelpful. For 100 Euro/ night this has got to be the most overpriced dump on the face of the earth. It was a disappointing end to an otherwise wonderful 2 1/2 week experience in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Ken-Jayne
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9.30pm on New Years Day with two friends, very easy to locate Hotel from the Accademia Vaporetto stop. We had rooms 108 and 115 - the latter being slightly larger - very clean and well serviced. Breakfast was extremely busy, with long queues after 9.30, but surprisingly good (apart from the coffee which was not what you expect in Italy). We paid 215 euros for the first night and 70 euros per night for the following three nights. Very good value for its location. We left our luggage in the unlocked room provided for collection later in the day - we always carry our own security device and locked our suitcases to the furniture in the room! Even though our visit was in January we still took advantage of the undercover outdoor seating for late night coffee from the bar, which was excellent (not from the breakfast machine). Would gladly stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Belle Arti
HotelInfo.Address: 912 / A Dorsoduro | Rio Terra Foscarini, 30100 Venice, Italy
